channel.title: Need [delta] unban unmute unipban unipmute plz
channel.description: i need deltas unmute unban unipban unipmute i have tried adding them but it dont remove the char names

item.title: Need [delta] unban unmute unipban unipmute plz
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Player Rights (just in case you would like to change the commands below):

0 = Normal Player 1 = Moderator 2 = Admnistrator 3 = Co-Owner, or Owner. Both the same. 4 = Hidden Administrator/Hidden Owner. Doesn't really matter what you call it, you can use Owner Commands.

Unban command:
First, please note that you need to be an administrator to use the following two commands. You can change it to whatever you want to have access to the command by editing the number at:
&& playerRights >= 2)

if (command.startsWith("unban") && playerRights >= 2) { try { String name = command.substring(6); java.util.List<String> bannedUsers = new java.util.ArrayList<String>(); BufferedReader input = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./config/bans.txt")); String s; String unbanned = null; while ((s = input.readLine()) != null) { if(!s.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) bannedUsers.add(s); else unbanned = s; } input.close(); BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./config/bans.txt")); for (String s1 : bannedUsers) { output.write(s1); output.newLine(); } output.close(); if(unbanned != null) sM("User "+name+" Successfully unbanned."); return; } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Unmute Command:

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && playerRights >= 2) { try { String name = command.substring(7); java.util.List<String> bannedUsers = new java.util.ArrayList<String>(); BufferedReader input = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./config/mutes.txt")); String s; String unbanned = null; while ((s = input.readLine()) != null) { if(!s.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) bannedUsers.add(s); else unbanned = s; } input.close(); BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./config/mutes.txt")); for (String s1 : bannedUsers) { output.write(s1); output.newLine(); } output.close(); if(unbanned != null) sM("User "+name+" successfully unmuted."); return; } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

I think when you use the ::unban and ::unmute command, it both unbans/unmutes them normal, or if they’re ip’d too.

Best of luck

  • Jackson.

Read full topic
